intro: Pollia sorzogonensis var. indica, commonly known as the Philippine orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful inflorescences that display a unique iridescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, often on tree trunks or rocks. Its flowers are highly specialized, with intricate structures that facilitate pollination by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
